channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: CodeRED Emergency Alert System Crippled by 'Inc Ransom' Attack, Disrupting US Public Safety
item.description:
The OnSolve CodeRED emergency alert system, a critical communication tool for hundreds of U.S. municipalities, has been taken offline following a ransomware attack claimed by the 'Inc Ransom' group. The attack, which began on November 1, 2025, resulted in the encryption of systems and the exfiltrati...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Targets M&A Blind Spots, Breaching Firms via Inherited SonicWall Devices
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group is exploiting security blind spots created during corporate mergers and acquisitions (M&A). According to research by ReliaQuest, Akira affiliates are gaining initial access to acquiring companies by compromising vulnerable SonicWall SSL VPN appliances inherited from smalle...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Gang Hits LG Energy Solution, Claims 1.7TB Data Theft
item.description:
South Korean battery manufacturing giant LG Energy Solution has confirmed it was the victim of a ransomware attack at one of its overseas facilities. The notorious Akira ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for the breach, alleging on its dark web leak site that it stole 1.7 terabytes of data ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Peak on Holidays and Weekends, Exploiting Low Staffing
item.description:
A new global study by Semperis, the "2025 Holiday Ransomware Risk Report," confirms that threat actors strategically launch attacks during holidays and weekends to exploit reduced security staffing. The report found that 52% of organizations were targeted during these off-hour periods. Alarmingly, 7...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: SANS Report: OT/ICS Cyber Incidents Rising, 40% Cause Downtime
item.description:
A new report from the SANS Institute highlights a dangerous trend in the security of Operational Technology (OT) and Industrial Control Systems (ICS). The '2025 State of ICS/OT Security Report' found that over 21% of organizations experienced a cyber incident in their OT environment in the past year...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sinobi Ransomware Strikes US Manufacturer and Indian Tech Firm
item.description:
The 'sinobi' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for two recent cyberattacks targeting organizations in the United States and India. The victims are Croft, a U.S.-based window and door manufacturer, and CHANGEPOND, an enterprise software company headquartered in Chennai, India. Both breaches...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Inc Ransom Cripples PA Attorney General's Office, Exfiltrates 5.7 TB of Data
item.description:
The Pennsylvania Office of the Attorney General (OAG) has confirmed it suffered a severe data breach orchestrated by the Inc Ransom ransomware group. The attackers exploited the 'CitrixBleed2' vulnerability (CVE-2025-5777) to gain initial access and subsequently exfiltrated 5.7 terabytes of highly s...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: RansomHouse Hits H&M and Adidas Supplier in Major Fashion Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
The RansomHouse ransomware group has attacked Fulgar S.p.A., a major Italian textile manufacturer and a key supplier for global fashion brands like H&M and Adidas. The attack, confirmed on November 3, 2025, resulted in the exfiltration and leak of sensitive corporate data. This incident highlights t...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals
item.description:
Pathology service provider Synnovis has officially confirmed that patient personal data, including names, NHS numbers, and dates of birth, was stolen during the June 2024 ransomware attack attributed to the Qilin gang. The attack caused widespread disruption to London hospitals, leading to the cance...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack
